text:
Koch crossed himself. 

"If I had been there, he would have killed me," he said.

"Did no one see the murderer?" 

"The house is a regular Noah's Ark," the head clerk replied.

Raskolnikov picked up his hat. He moved toward the door but didn’t reach it.

He woke in a chair. Someone supported him. Another held a glass of yellow water. 

“What’s this? Are you ill?” Nikodim Fomitch asked sharply.

“He could hardly hold his pen,” the clerk noted, returning to work.

“Have you been ill long?” Ilya Petrovitch asked.

“Since yesterday,” Raskolnikov muttered.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov, feeling unwell, is questioned about his whereabouts and condition by Nikodim Fomitch and Ilya Petrovitch after fainting.
